titles.title: A bill to require studies on support services for families of members of the National Guard and Reserve who are undergoing deployment.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary: 6/19/2007--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of Defense to conduct a study to evaluate the feasibility and advisability of: (1) contracting with a private entity with expertise in the health and well-being of families and children in order to enhance and develop support services for the children of members of the National Guard and reserve who are deployed; and (2) establishing a pilot program on family-to-family support for families of deployed members of the National Guard and reserve.
